meanings.definition: To make or become tougher or stronger.
meanings.sent1: He practiced every day to toughen his muscles.
meanings.sent2: Exercise can help toughen your body over time.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's secret power was to instantly toughen his skin.
meanings.sent4: Facing challenges can toughen a person's resolve like steel.
meanings.sent5: The cold winter winds toughen the trees, making them resilient.

meanings.definition: To make more strict or severe.
meanings.sent1: The new rules will toughen the penalties for breaking them.
meanings.sent2: Laws are in place to toughen consequences for criminal behavior.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's strictness seemed to toughen with each passing day.
meanings.sent4: The boss decided to toughen the company policies to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The coach's training regimen was designed to toughen the team's discipline.
